topic.title: Antilibrary is not loading properly
topic.body:
The following error message is appearing in the right upper corner of the web page:
"Internal error: Exception: No merger (147nKEb9bBJgBDgQytEQhmiGjF8e6HkEua) permission to load:
merged-Antilibrary/19sZZmJPz1hADwitEs2XT6U46uHLGbHqKi/data/users/1Jgu3kQaBojGnFj82E6Gd3tsyAsKCk5SX6/data.json (Antilibrary not in [])
UiWebsocket.py line 187 > MergerSite/MergerSitePlugin.py line 156 > MergerSite/MergerSitePlugin.py line 133 > MergerSite/MergerSitePlugin.py line 49"

I am not a programmer. Can I do something about it?

topic.title: My favorite place on the internet :D
topic.body:
My favorite place on the internet is https://e621.net.
Why? Because as I know, this is the only place on the internet, where you can watch a video (https://e621.net/post/show/1835956) about a PokÃ©mon starting to literally fuck a girl, then bites her head off, then fuck her faster. It is so sick! But I love it! :D
What about you? What is your favorite place on the internet?

topic.title: Isn't it funny?
topic.body:
You hear a phone ring, and it could be anybody. But a ringing phone has to be answered, doesn't it?

What would you say to this?

topic.title: What else is there to do, when life turns on you, and you have retreated into some small room?
topic.body: Let us say that you do not have a computer, laptop, internet, nor smartphones or other electronic devices. First you watch. You look out your window. You see people coming in and out of the phone booth on the street. The same ones every day. You make up names for them. You imagine their stories. But is it okay, if eventually, you get tired of imagining, and one day you follow one of them? And you hear all of his lies? And you decide that his sins should be punished? What would you do in this situation? This situation is completely imaginary, I am not in it, nor anyone else I know.

topic.title: Running out of alloted space on ZeroTalk
topic.body:
Hello!
The website (ZeroTalk) says "used: 45.0k/50k" and "You are running out of your allowed space, please contact the site's admin at nofish to raise your limit."
I tried to send a message to her/him (twice), but instead of sending them to "nofish", ZeroMail sent the messages to "nofishes" both of the times. What should I do? How can I contact the site's admin to raise my alloted space limit?
Thank you.

topic.title: ZeroTalking To Be Murdered By
topic.body:
How do you do, ladies and gentlemen?
My name is Xplosive
And this is ZeroTalking to Be Murdered By
It is mood text in a jugular vein
And I hope you like it
Our talking requires only the simplest of equipment
An internet-capable device
A keyboard
And a 38 caliber revolver
Naturally, the conversation is long-lasting
Even though you may not be
So why don't you relax?
Lean back and enjoy yourself
Until the coroner comes

I write this, because I am getting close to the alloted space limit. Currently used: 48.3k/50k.
Once I publish this post (if I can), the current complete alloted space will pretty much be used.

1581696052_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: Hello. I am one from the masses. I mean that I am not a programmer or anything similar. I am only a regular user. Nowadays I use Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS. This is my first comment on ZeroTalk.

> [z0net](#comment_11_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMrYDJfS): linux is for everybody guy, that's why its free, easy to use and install.  If you want to do linuxfromscratch or something different you are free to. If you don't want to take it that far, install Gentoo and use a different init system. Devuan is systemd free as well and based on the fan favorite, Debian.

Yes, exactly. I would like to suggest Ubuntu and Linux Mint. These Linux distributions are created for the masses, good for beginners, and have a good community support. Nowadays I am using Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, and when I have some problem with it, I usually ask on the local forum, and people always help me to solve the problem. Sometimes I also help others to solve their problems, if I can.

1581933903_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body: I would not say that the gaming is a waste of time in general, because it is not. You can earn money by playing certain (mostly blockchain based) games. For example Steem Monsters/Splinterlands, NextColony, Holy Bread, Prospectors, etc. You can also gain other values by playing various games. For example language knowledge, memory and other skills.

1582025950_12zcNM3BD6QwkonPrnCdbWBnGzu9b.body: You ask this question as if the world wide web would be a non-functional thing. Or a thing, which is not good for anything. But you can accomplish many set of goals with the world wide web. And I would not say that it is unreliable.

1582356450_12tcdM86TcZQeHEsSea3kTdTiExBK.body: Probably they (the disappeared people) became the victims of drug dealers. Or even the victims of human trafficking. Maybe the drug dealers (or drug addicts) (or other people) will sell them (or their organs) to get money. If the disappeared people are women (or there are women amongst the disappeared people), the people, who took them may even make them prostitutes. Or the disappeared people saw, heard, read or know something by any other means (for example they figured out something) that they should not, and this is why they disappeared. There could be many (or even multiple) reasons.

xcape2net: How do you know that the researcher calculated with only 50 samples? Kanade have not wrote in the post how much cases did the researcher person used in his calculations. He wrote only that "multiple disappearances from around the US". The number of cases is not specified in the post. The researcher could have used more than one case from a single US state.

1582366551_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
I think that important news and important informations should be put on decentralized networks. Such as the Steem blockchain. Or even the ZeroNet, which we are using now. According to the Wikipedia, "As of 2016 there was no way to take down a ZeroNet page which still had seeders, thus making such pages immune to third-party methods of taking them down, including DMCA takedown notices".
This is probably still true. But the more decentralized networks the people are using, the more harder for the third-parties to take down something.

1581957882_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
Then the EOS (and probably many other) blockchain is also a pyramid scheme.
By the way, some people are confusing Steemit with the Steem blockchain. Steemit is not a blockchain. Steemit is a dApp (decentralized application) on the Steem blockchain.

1583450778_18YbbFYMzM2PLZwPLddxGqRsjbBFH.body: Cryptocurrency. Create a Steem account, and be active on the Steem blockchain. You can start it for free. You will earn Steem and Steem Dollars (SBD). You can exchange them to fiat currencies,  such as USD and EUR.

> [buzel](#comment_5_18YbbFYMzM2PLZwPLddxGqRsjbBFHLFhid): What's the requirements for it

There are no specific requirements. You can do it in your web browser from steemit.com, busy.org, steempeak.com, etc. There are many Steem blockchain interfaces and dApps (decentralized applications). Once you have a Steem account, you can use all of them with it. For example DTube and DSound. DTube is similar to YouTube, DSound is similar to Soundcloud. So you can post blog posts, comments, photos, videos, sounds/music, anything you like.

> [randname666](#comment_8_1HpSHmnQ3cp4oP3hRQsqr1f4U5T7ZL29zK): Lmao, quite a lot. From crypto mining, human OCR (aka. type in captchas), DDoS/SEO (yeah there are people paying to do this) to decentralized money laundering, cryptocurrency exchanging, online phishing etc. Depends on what device you are using, what skill you got, what you already have, and what risk you would like to take.

Yes, but watch out for scams, because there are many. If you are planning to do a job on a website, then try to search for the name of the website + scam or review, before you would actually invest time, work/money or any effort into it to avoid scams. This could be useful/helpful in almost any case, because even some of the crypto exchanges are scams. So be careful.

1583587826_154DLn4k3ckpT1v151SLaFh7mmy4T.body: Rather the hidden tax on the stupid. At least we used to say that. Even one of my friends say that, who plays it. I do not play it. Lottery is worse than gambling. The chance you actually win something big is less than 1 to 10 000 million. Or even worse. 99% of the people only lose money with it. Especially in the long term. Knowing this, it would be foolish to "play" lottery. Many people played it for decades, and did not win anything on the long run. They only lost money. Just like you said: "dying in an accident or getting hit by a lightning are many many times higher." People should save their money, and invest it. There are some relatively safe investments with relatively small risks. They would increase their money in the long term in that case. Even if it would be a small increase, at least it would still be an increase. Some government securities in my country (Hungary) have a yearly interest rate of around 6% in the long term (in the fifth year). For example the Magyar ÃllampapÃ­r Plusz (MÃP Plusz).

> [steelmemes](#comment_32_1N2JLPM7vMtsQkPZiatLHyU6shFKP7aZWg): Spending one or tow dollars a week on a Powerball ticket isn't a tax, and it's not going to break the bank. Most people spend far more than that on coffee every day.

I like coffee, but nowadays I do not spend $1 USD on it daily. Sometimes not even the half of it.
Okay, I am not from the USA, but from Hungary.
Nowadays I usually spend 100-250 HUF per day on coffee, which is $0.33 USD-$0.84 USD.
$1 USD is currently (on 2020.03.08, 19:46 CET) 298.92 HUF.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1857_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): There are $1 energy drinks.

Other than tea and coffee, I have not tried any energy drinks so far, and I am not planning to try any energy drinks in the future either. I know, many people do drink them. Some regularly.

1583559326_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdo.body: There are many Near-Death Experiences (NDEs) with various experiences. Many of them are claiming that they met (seen or felt) God and others. Some of the people forcefully sent back to their bodies, while others got a chance to choose to stay or go. If you are interested in NDEs, then I would like to suggest the website of the NDERF (Near-Death Experience Research Foundation). You can find the current (recently shared) NDEs on the following link: https://www.nderf.org/Archives/NDERF_NDEs.html

> [fkljioe](#comment_3_1ECDDfizbAbA5MgiVVyZqRZrjZAdkkpoQA): It's the matrix

Maybe you are right in the sense that we are currently living in an immerse-like illusion.

> [cecil](#comment_1_13T5MCht5aHSYqLBVDsgN3bsVKjQNVVpnM): The master of the universe

Really? What kind of master? Which universe? Certainly not this. This world is full of suffering and pain. Both humans and animals are suffering. This whole world is built upon suffering. Some of the animals are literally eating each other alive. Many are a little bit "mercier", and kill first. What kind of master would create a world like this? Probably a sadistic one. If this so called master really loves ALL of his creations, then why do he let them suffer? Why do he let them have ANY amount of pain?

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_963_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): There are so many opinions. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GodI suggest you to start with Christianity, because that is what i did and found it to make sense. Also thanks to prayers i feel it is the right way to act based on what the Jesus Christ did. It is known that people pray to God. It was said that prayer should not be underestimated. The person who is humble and willing to hear and change for the better is valuable.

I am not just/only willing, but I am trying to change for the better. It is used to say that God has a big plan. I hope that we (both the humanity as a whole, and every other creature) will all have love, peace, happiness and everything we need in the end.

What do you believe in?

What will happen to us after our earthly lives ends? Do you believe in God? Jesus? Angels? Fallen angels? Hell? Satan? Demons? Other creatures? Other realms/dimensions/places? Anything. Nothing? What do you think about Creation? Life? How the universe/galaxy/world was created?

Thank you. I will take a look into them. I have not even heard about 8chan so far, but I heard about Millchan and 0chan (0chan.bit).

Yes, for now. But the earthly life are not eternal for your current physical human body. What do you think/believe will happen after the end of it?
*is not eternal. Sorry for the typo. I edited the life/lives, body/bodies words, but forgot to change the "are" to "is", before I sent the comment.

1583980969_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdo.body:
I fell in love with a woman in middle school (between 2007 and 2012) very deeply. She knew it, because she was the one, who asked, who (which woman) I like in the class. I told her the truth that I like (love) her, and I knew that she felt the same. Or so I thought. It was a true love at first sight. At least from my side. Then one day a new guy arrived in the class, and she started kissing and being with him from one day to another. Once I literally cried because of her. Some may think that it is not a man-like behavior, but I say that it is not a shame to express your feelings. We are all humans. After the school ended (in 2012), she switched to another guy, so she is changing her man as others change their socks. I saw that on Facebook. I have not seen her since the banquet. 

My love towards her was/is so deep that I think that I will keep thinking about her for the rest of my earthly life.
So a woman once broke my heart. No other woman will do that again.
I am happy that now I am single. And I am independent.

No woman, no problem. Or as Bob Marley said/singed: "No woman, no cry".

> [sfs9](#comment_65_1Ev2p6pn33TkPNNrMbNFwSspPzivpKaTKD): Nah, the first love will be remembered indeed, but no worries, Your heart can be broken many times :-D  [...]

Theoretically and technically yes, but practically no, if you do not let yourself fall in another love, your heart cannot be broken again. Love is letting a girl "kill" you, but trusting her not to. And my first (and last) love "killed" me. I will not give this chance/choice to a woman again. I will not love another woman. I was weak, but this experience made me stronger. I think that if you are strong enough to control your emotions, then your heart cannot be broken multiple times. Not even once, if you are strong enough not to fall in love from the start.

> [1bfqutudhtexlka](#comment_167_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2EhuAY): because i have autism

I also have autism. And I really/seriously do have an autism spectrum disorder.
Having autism spectrum disorder does not necessarily have anything to do with being single.

> [happyhippo](#comment_7_1MHt7kHieXeogoLntiLkqeBh1uVh9wW4Ly): You know, this actually made me self-reflect, much more than I expected.I spent a good 20 mins thinking about this.Honestly, I have no idea.

Is being single feels good or bad? Have you had a girlfriend/wife? Or have you ever been in a relationship? I am just/only curious. Being single nowadays feels good for me.

> [happyhippo](#comment_8_1MHt7kHieXeogoLntiLkqeBh1uVh9wW4Ly): Man, whatever you ever do in your life, you decide how you want to feel about it. [...]

"Man, whatever you ever do in your life, you decide how you want to feel about it."
How you want, yes. How you actually feel, often no. You often cannot even decide. The feelings are just/only coming, and you feel them without being able to do anything about it/them.

1583969906_16cUVejYswnQhxY6LRP6ftoC9WezK.body:

Why would that be my responsibility? That is their responsibility. If they have "something to hide", then that is not my problem/responsibility, but their own. Everyone should take care their own privacy/data protection.

Thank you, but this is something different to what I am looking for. I already have a physical phone number, and I used free online SMS sender services in the past to send SMS messages to it (and to other phone numbers).

1583931502_1PzqXnnYNvUNj4EjU1X6VCRAGFo7R.body:
> [kec](#comment_11_1PzqXnnYNvUNj4EjU1X6VCRAGFo7Rk9AWN): I'll take both. An exchange would be wonderful. The only thing that I have managed to locate thus far - after the Cryptopia disaster - is Kucoin, but I am not sure how that plays out with international law and sanctions. If you have any advice on particular coins, I am definitely listening as well. Thank you in advance.

I currently know the following well constructed, secure, reputable altcoins and exchanges:

Coins: Steem/Steem Power, Steem Dollars (SBD), LBRY Credits (LBC), Uptrennd (1UP).
Exchanges, which I used so far: Coinbase, Blocktrades, Bittrex, Poloniex.
Exchanges, which I have not used so far, but may be used to exchange at least two of the above mentioned cryptocurrencies: BitShares, GOPAX, HitBTC, UpBit, Yensesa.

Exchanges, which can be used to exchange Uptrennd (1UP): P2PB2B, Idex, Altilly. I have not tried these.
There will be probably more.
By the way, Uptrennd (1UP) is my newest experience in my cryptocurrency journey, and Uptrennd (1UP) sounds very promising. Nowadays Uptrennd (1UP) is quickly gaining popularity. Uptrennd (1UP) is probably one of the best social networks and one of the best altcoins in 2020.

There are many other cryptocurrencies and exchanges.

Do you know what is good/best in the above mention coins? 
You can get/earn all of these coins without investing a single cent.
The transactions with Steem and with Steem Dollars (SBD) are free and fast (around 3 seconds) on the Steem blockchain. You can buy and sell Steem with/for Steem Dollars (SBD) on the Steem blockchain on an internal (built-in) currency market without any external exchange. Probably this is the best way to get involved/started in the cryptocurrency world.
Steem Dollars (SBD) is supposed to be a stable coin, which should be around $1 USD all the time, but it is not. Sometimes it is less, sometimes it is much more than $1 USD.

I hope that you find this comment useful/helpful.

Please let me know, if you know any other similar cryptocurrencies/exchanges.
Thank you for reading! Have a nice day!

People say that it is not mobile friendly, no 100% dark mode support. I have not tried ZeroNet Mobile so far, so I cannot rate it at the moment. This is an open source program. Developed by the community for the community. So the source code must be available somewhere, but I have not found it so far.
But I have found the source code for the ZeroNet Android app (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.mkg20001.zeronet): https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-kivy
They probably run out of their allowed space limit.

1584077470_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
I am using Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS. No program updates itself without my explicit agreement, because to install/update/remove a program, a user must use administrator rights/privileges (sudo), which is not used by default. When you use that, the system asks for your administrator password. Microsoft Windows operating systems should also work like this. They would be much safer.

By the way, updating a program without the explicit agreement of the user may backfire because of hackers exploiting it by using (putting) viruses and other malicious programs (into the update).

> [schiz0](#comment_107_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): Absolutely not, but I think that every update should be a choice; anyway we also consider that software evolution is not an end user choice so we can  consider "Unattended updates" as this kind of undecision

Software evolution on each individual's computers is really an end user choice. You may use whatever software you like to use. Nowadays I still use MS-DOS 6.22, Windows 3.11, Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 2000, Windows XP, and a lot of old games. Many other people also do this.

> [schiz0](#comment_108_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k): Yes, but what I mean is that, for example, windows is windows, you (if you're not a coder) can't determine the software as is, you, obiouvusly, can choose what kind of software to install [...]

That is a fair point. And Windows is not even open source. Most of the Windows programs are also not open source, so you cannot really see what it is on your computer, if you use such softwares, even, if you are a coder. Nowadays my main desktop computer runs Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, which is an open source Linux distribution.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1259_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): I can't read schiz0's comment for some reason, could you please copy it for me?

His comment:
"Yes, but what I mean is that, for example, windows is windows, you (if you're not a coder) can't determine the software as is, you, obiouvusly, can choose what kind of software to install

And we can consider "Unattended updates" as a coder ,not an end user, choice of software evolution"

> [gitcenter](#comment_1257_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): How would the hackers make an update though?

I do not know, but a well prepared hacker can (are able to) do many things. It is better to be safe. To use safety measures. Such as manual updates. But even those are not enough in many cases. Many/most (?) of the operating systems contains (national) (USA) backdoors. Even open source ones, such as OpenBSD. And that system is inteneded to be secure by default. So there could be vulnerabilities, even in an open source code, and people (not even coders) would not even notice it. Or even if they would notice it, they could not do many things about it/them.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_1011_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): I have spent much time in isolation (work/choice),  It's easy to see the worst part of anything, especially people. If I focus more on my own preconceived notions, presumptions, and judgements than others... I enjoy it more.
